comments.body: Shouldn't the sensor use the execution date by default? As Airflow's model is built around execution dates, I think that they should be preferred over `datetime.utcnow`. In that case, I would change the argument to `now`, with a value of `True` indicating that the now time should be used (and the default being False).

The idea behind that having current date as default (`use_task_execution_day`=`False`) - most of the use-cases for any of these sensors are to stop until a certain day. For e.g. for weekdaysensor - the users want to run the DAG on weekends when everyone is on holiday. 

Also, all of our current sensors use current date (as compared to execution_date) - but like you I wanted an option to use execution_date as well as Airflow model is certainly built around execution dates, hence I added this functionality to at least this 2 sensors for now.
Could be changed to a set of days instead of a single day, so that the sensor can filter for any given combinations of days, rather than only on one given day.
Yes, I like that idea, will do that tonight :)
